ARABIC: وَحَنَانًا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَزَكَوٰةً وَكَانَ تَقِيًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and tenderness and purity from Us - he had taqwa -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And compassion from Us, and goodness. So he was devout,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and We also endowed him with tenderness and purity, and he was exceedingly pious
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We gave him compassion and purity. He was a pious human being,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And compassion from Ourselves, and chastity; and he was extremely pious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And Hananan from Us, and Zakatan, and he was pious,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And tenderness from Us and purity, and he was one who guarded (against evil),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and a tenderness from Us, and purity; and he was godfearing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And compassion from Our presence, and purity; and he was devout,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and tenderness [of heart] and purity. He was pious,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And tenderness from Our presence and purity, and he was God-fearing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and a compassion and purity from Us. He was Godwary
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And piety (for all creatures) as from Us, and purity: He was devout,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (made him) sympathetic to men as a mercy (or a grant) from Us, and pure from sins [i.e. Yahya (John)] and he was righteous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and tenderness from Us and purity, and he was cautious;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And tenderness from Us, and innocence. He was devout.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:13] and compassion, a mercy for mankind, from Us, from Our presence, and purity, a charity for them, and he was God-fearing — it is related that he never committed a sin, nor contemplated [committing] one;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And compassion from Our presence) and We gave him compassion from Our presence towards his parents, (and purity) as an act of charity to them; it is also said that this means: We gave righteousness with regard to his religion; (and he was devout) he was obedient to his Lord,
